alert.note: Alert for Calhoun (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 6:17PM EDT until July 29 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Calhoun County in the Panhandle of Florida... * Until 600 PM CDT. * At 517 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 15 miles west of Blountstown, and is nearly stationary. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Moose Pond, Clarksville, Red Oak, Abe Springs, Sharpstown, Chason, Chipola, Camps Head, Center Lake, Willis, Frink, Blountstown Airport, Macedonia, Durham, White Pond and Scotts Ferry. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
